citation.article-title: Myceligenerans xiligouense gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel hyphae-forming member of the family Promicromonosporaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Myceligenerans (My.ce.li.ge′ne.rans. N.L. neut. n. mycelium filamentous cells; L. part. adj. generans producing; N.L. subst. Myceligenerans hyphae-forming microbe).
Substrate mycelia are well developed and branched in and on the medium.
The surface of substrate mycelium bears fragmented cells and spore chains with one or two spores at the tips of the mycelium.
Peptidoglycan type is A4α, variation l-lys←l-thr←d-Glu.
Cell wall sugars are glucose, mannose and galactose.

Major menaquinones are MK-9(H4) and MK-9(H6); predominant fatty acids are ai-C15 : 0, i-C15 : 0; cells contain phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phospatidylinositol, three unidentified phospholipids and one unidentified glycolipid.
The type species is Myceligenerans xiligouense.
